session
Class AbstractSessionDriver

java.lang.Object
  session.AbstractSessionDriver
All Implemented Interfaces:
SessionDriver
Direct Known Subclasses:
InsecureSessionDriver, SecureSessionDriver
public abstract class AbstractSessionDriver
extends java.lang.Object
implements SessionDriver

This class provides a skeletal implementation of the SessionHandler interface to minimize the effort required to implement this interface.

The process of implementing a session handler by extending this class, the programmer needs only to provide an implementation for the getSignableSessionHandler method.

In addition to the method getSignableSessionHandler, a concrete implementation of this class should implement the certification policy.

There are two types of session handlers. The first one is the interface with the ForroSim main class. One type is a session handler that starts a session GUI. Such a session handler interacts with the user and with the locations' signable session handlers. Otherwise, the session handler does not interact with the user. Its interactions are exclusively with the locations' signable session handlers.

If session handler interacts with a session GUI, then it keeps a map of all workspaces started by this session GUI. Otherwise, it only keeps the workspaces which this location belongs to (they are started by the signable session handler).

Author:
Ricardo Corrï¿½a (correa@lia.ufc.br)

AbstractSessionDriver

public AbstractSessionDriver(java.lang.String sessionName,
                             java.lang.Object security,
                             SessionsHandler shandler)
Creates a session driver with the specified security policy and the specified session name. This initializes an entry at the handler map with this location name as a key and the SignableSessionHandler implementation as a value.

Parameters:
sessionName - the session name
security - the security policy

startLocation

public boolean startLocation(java.lang.String locationName)
Description copied from interface: SessionDriver
Forro is started at a specified location. A session handler and a location driver are instantiated at this new location. This method must be invoked before requesting any other RemoteInstantiator methods at the specified location.

Specified by:
startLocation in interface SessionDriver
Parameters:
locationName - the new location to start
Returns:
true if the session handler and the location driver has been correctly instantiated

startWorkspace

public boolean startWorkspace(java.lang.String locationName,
                              java.lang.String workName,
                              java.lang.String workImplName,
                              java.lang.String middleImplName)
Description copied from interface: SessionDriver
A workspace is started with a specified name and a specified middleware. Adds this location to the workspace specified by its name and the name of the class implementing it. If the specified workspace does not exist yet, then this method instantiates a new workspace driver to handle the new workspace created. The middleware used by this workspace is specified by the name of the class implementing it.

Specified by:
startWorkspace in interface SessionDriver
Parameters:
locationName - TODO
workName - the new workspace to start
workImplName - TODO
middleImplName - the implementation of the workspace driver, which determines the type of the workspace
Returns:
true if workspace has been correctly instantiated

bindPorts

public boolean bindPorts(java.lang.String providesPortName,
                         java.lang.String usesPortName,
                         java.lang.String linkName,
                         BindingProperties bindingProp)
Description copied from interface: SessionDriver
Bind a uses port to a provides port. The model component of each port is specified. This binding operation should be performed by the session handler at the uses port location.

To perform the binding operation, the session handler at the uses port location first bind the uses port at the model driver of the specified uses model component. Then, it takes the hash code of the uses port returned and asks to the session handler at the provides port location to bind the provides port.

Specified by:
bindPorts in interface SessionDriver
Parameters:
providesPortName - the provides port name locationName.modelName.portName
usesPortName - the uses port name locationName.modelName.portName
linkName - WorkspaceName.linkName
bindingProp - TODO
Returns:
true if the port could be correctly created and bound
